clinical_study.brief_title: Oxcarbazepine for the Treatment of Chronic Peripheral Neuropathic Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Oxcarbazepine for the Treatment of Chronic Peripheral Neuropathic Pain: Predictors of Response - a Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this trial is to determine if the effect of oxcarbazepine on chronic peripheral nerve pain depends on the supposed mechanism of the pain, ie. if oxcarbazepine mainly relieve pain in patients with irritable nerves.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Total pain rated on numeric rating scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements from week 6 of treatment period
primary_outcome.description: Pain is rated daily on 0-10 point numeric rating scales. From the daily ratings from week 6 of each treatment period a median value is determined and used for data analysis. The analysis will compare scores between treatments (oxcabazepine vs placebo) and treatment effects (placebo-oxcarbazepine) between groups irritable nociceptor vs non-irritable nociceptors and some other subgroups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Response defined as at least 50% reduction in pain score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 6 of each treatment period vs. baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Response defined as 50% reduction in pain score (median value week 6 of treatment period compared to median value during baseline period). Repsonse rates for each treatment and each phenotype will be calculated
Different pain dimensions as rated by Neuropathic Pain Symptom Inventory
Rating on numeric rating scales of pain induced by stimulation with cold rollers, stiff von Frey hain and dynamic touch with rubber sponge
Numeric rating scale ratings of pain induced sleep disturbance, median value of ratings from week 6 of each treatment period
Rating of quality of life with numeric rating scale
Number of paracetamol 500 mg used during the last week of each treamtent period

arm_group.description: Oxcarbazepine is gradually increased during 21 days from 300 mg x 1 daily to 2400 mg, and kept on that dose ( 2400 mg) for three weeks.

intervention.description: Oxcarbazepine capsules 300 mg is gradually increased from 300 mg/day to 2400 mg/day Placebo capsules increase from 1/day to 8/day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age > 18 years old
- definite or probable neuropathic pain
- diagnosis of polyneuropathy, postherpetic neuralgia or peripheral nerve inju
- pain duration > 3 months
- pain rating at baseline >= 4 point NRS
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- other non-neuropathic pain condition
- allergy to oxcarbazepine
- renal or hepatic impairment
- epilepsy
- depression and other serious psychiatric disorders
- serious medical condition
- previous treatment for neuropathic that cannot be stopped
- pregnancy
- patients expected not to be able to comply with study protocol
- treatment with anticonvulsants, antidepressant or opioids
